bio:treatment.description: Culms 70-210 cm. Panicles about twice as long as wide, open, erect, exserted; branches ascending to spreading; pulvini well-developed. Upper florets blackish, shiny, disarticulating at maturity
bio:treatment.discussion: Panicum miliaceum subsp. ruderale is now naturalized over much of the Flora region. It may become a major weed, especially in corn fields.
